ej,littg801,M,reedr901,Decision concerning two trips trips to mound ej,pennb002,P,reedr901,Balls and strikes $LA manager Little visited mound and HP umpire Reed came out to speed up meeting; Kent told catcher Martin that the last pitch to Gonzalez was a strike; Reed said something derogatory to Kent; Little left mound toward plate to cool off argument; Little returned to mound to talk to Penny; SD manager Bochy came out to claim this was two trips to the mound; umpires huddled and then ruled Bochy was correct; by rule 8.06d, Penny was required to pitch to next batter and then leave game; Little ejected arguing the whole sequence of events; Reed handed the ball to Penny who, in an expletive- filled manner, told Reed that if he had called that pitch a strike, none of this would have happened; Penny was ejected by Reed
